instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.06A
threads.message: Hello. I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that originally had 5v only but I replaced <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and that restored 20v and the board booted fully. I had only the board sitting on my bench connected to a test screen and charger and I saw it make it to the login screen. I then put it back in the case and tried to turn it on again and now it was stuck at 20v 0.25A with both fans on high and no image on the screen. When I took the board out of the case again, it would only go to 20V 0.06A now with nothing else connected. The board seems to have all S0 voltages except for <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, which is 0.63v. It is not short to ground and I cannot seem to figure out where that 0.6v is coming from. I checked <CHIP>U8205</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> are 3.3v. I removed <CHIP>U8205</CHIP> but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is still 0.63v with it removed from the board. Not sure what to check next.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.06A
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.06A
threads.message: Yea I changed <CHIP>U8205</CHIP> and the board is booting now. I tried to boot from my USB test OS, but it load about halfway and then it shows the prohibitory symbol. I tried all 4 USB ports and it does the same thing and it also does the same thing using a USB stick with the Catalina installer on it. Both of these USB devices work fine on other macbooks so I know its not the drives. Is there some setting that would prevent booting from USB on this model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 20v 0.06A
